items.title: Melania’s memecoin causes 48% drop in Trump crypto token
items.summary:
- President-elect Donald Trump’s memecoin, $Trump, dropped as much as 48% following the launch of Melania Trump’s memecoin, $Melania.
- $Melania was announced on January 19 and reached a valuation of US$5.69 billion.
- $Trump’s price fell from US$73 to US$38, later recovering to US$52.
- $Melania was launched by MKT World, LLC, a company created by Melania Trump for NFT sales.
- Market reactions are mixed, with concerns over launching two similar tokens.

items.title: Trump signs executive order to delay TikTok ban for 75 days
items.summary:
- President Trump signed an executive order on **January 21**, extending the deadline for ByteDance to sell TikTok's US operations by **75 days**.
- This extension prevents TikTok from being banned in the US for the time being.
- The order instructs the US Attorney General to postpone enforcement of a ban that would require companies like Apple and Google to remove the app from their stores.
- The decision follows a recent **US Supreme Court** ruling about the sale of TikTok to an American entity due to national security concerns.

items.title: Self-driving firm Inceptio plans US IPO
items.summary:
- Inceptio Technology, a Chinese company focusing on self-driving technology for heavy-duty trucks, is exploring a US IPO this year.
- The company aims to raise between US$100 million and US$200 million.
- If successful, Inceptio would join WeRide Inc. and Pony AI Inc. in US exchanges after previous delays due to SEC inquiries.
- Decisions on the IPO's size and timing are still pending and may change.
- Inceptio, also known as Yingche Technology Shanghai Co., has not publicly commented on the stock market listing.

items.title: US VC firm launches $50m fund for Indian tech startups
items.author: Amit Srivastava, Shanti Mohan, Vivek Khare, Gagan Saksena
items.summary:
- US-based VC firm SamVed launches a $50 million fund for early-stage tech startups in India.
- Focus areas include AI, fintech, agritech, healthcare, ecommerce, upskilling, and consumer brands.
- Investment sizes range from $80,000 to $1 million in pre-seed and pre-series A rounds.
- The fund will offer operational support, including an in-house CTO, mentorship, and access to global networks.
- Three startups have already received investments, but names are undisclosed.

items.title: Indian online pharmacy PharmEasy co-founders exit amid challenges
items.summary:
- Four co-founders of API Holdings, the parent company of PharmEasy, are set to leave: Dharmil Sheth, Dhaval Shah, Harsh Parekh, and Hardik Dedhia.
- Siddharth Shah will remain as the sole co-founder and CEO.
- PharmEasy’s revenue declined by 15% to US$660 million in FY24, but losses were cut by 50% year-on-year to US$300 million due to cost-cutting measures.
- Founded in 2015, PharmEasy merged with Ascent Health in 2020 to form API Holdings.
- Reasons for the co-founders' exit and their future plans are currently unclear, with no comment from PharmEasy.

items.title: Chinese ride-hailing firm launches app 7.0, expands travel
items.summary:
- Didi Global launched version 7.0 of its app on January 19.
- The update introduces overseas travel services in select Asian cities, including Japan, Singapore, and Malaysia.
- New features allow users to access ride-hailing platforms like Grab and Kakao T.
- Didi aims to strengthen its presence in Latin America with improved delivery options and local partnerships.
- Its overseas ride-hailing division reports profitability, handling around 10.16 million orders daily, which is 95% of Didi’s total international order volume.

items.title: Indoor air monitor startup raises $3.7m in equity, debt
items.summary:
- Indoor air quality monitoring company uHoo raised US$3.7 million in a funding round comprising equity and debt.
- Funding round led by Wavemaker Ventures and Menarco Development Corporation, with participation from multiple investors.
- Funds will be used for expansion in the B2B sector and to develop new hardware and software solutions.
- uHoo's technology monitors air quality, humidity, temperature, and pollutants in real-time.
- Main product, the uHoo Aura, tracks 16 parameters and integrates with building systems for better air quality and energy efficiency.
- uHoo serves clients across Asia Pacific, Europe, and the Americas, including property developers and government organizations.

items.title: Zomato’s profit drops 57% as Blinkit expands
items.summary:
- Zomato Ltd. reports a 57% decline in profit for the October-December quarter, totaling 590 million rupees (US$6.8 million).
- Expected profits were 2.3 billion rupees (US$27.6 million).
- Blinkit recorded an adjusted EBITDA loss of 1.03 billion rupees (US$12.3 million), up from 890 million rupees (US$10.6 million) last year.
- The company aims to open 2,000 stores by December 2025, increasing operational costs.
- Zomato anticipates Blinkit will continue incurring losses for 1-2 quarters due to aggressive expansion.

items.title: Israeli facial recognition firm acquired for $125m
items.summary:
- Facial recognition technology company Oosto (formerly AnyVision) acquired by Metropolis for $125 million.
- The acquisition was mainly done through Metropolis shares rather than cash.
- This sale indicates challenges for Oosto, which had a valuation of $500 million and raised $352 million in 2019.
- Currently, Oosto has an estimated annual revenue of only $10 million and has reduced its workforce from over 200 to a few dozen.

items.title: China sets up $8.2b AI fund amid US controls
items.summary:
- China has established an AI investment fund with an initial capital of 60 billion yuan (approximately US$8.2 billion).
- The fund was created in response to new US export controls on advanced semiconductors and the addition of Chinese companies to a trade blacklist.
- Registered in Shanghai on January 19, the fund is a joint venture between state-backed Guozhi Investment and the China Integrated Circuit Industry Investment Fund Phase III.
- It will focus on equity investments and asset management, but specific details are not disclosed.

items.title: Blinkit to open dark stores in small cities
items.author: Deepinder Goyal, Albinder Dhindsa
items.summary:
- Blinkit plans to expand its dark store presence in smaller cities over the next year.
- Currently, 80% of revenue comes from large cities.
- CEO Albinder Dhindsa noted increased customer awareness and adoption due to competition.
- Competitive landscape has hindered margin expansion for the quarter.
- Customer retention rates have remained stable, averaging 42% to 44% over two years.

items.title: Why SG digital banks can’t stop at banking
items.summary:
- High interest rates have driven growth for Singapore’s digital banks, allowing competitive promotional rates despite being unprofitable.
- MariBank maintained a 2.7% interest rate for its savings account throughout 2024, lowering it to 2.5% in 2025.
- Digital banks in Singapore extended higher promotional rates to all customers without any time limit, unlike those in Hong Kong.
- MariBank improved from net interest expense in 2022 to net interest income in 2023, while GXS and Trust increased their net interest income by 6x.
- In 2024, digital banks leveraged growing deposits to launch loan products, with Trust’s deposits reaching S$3 billion by June 2024.
- GXS and its subsidiary GXBank combined deposits exceeded US$1.1 billion as of September 2024.
- Digital banks leverage customer data for personalized services, a capability currently not offered by traditional banks to customers below the affluent level.

items.title: East Ventures secures secondary transaction with Coller
items.summary:
- East Ventures completes its first GP-led secondary transaction with Coller Capital.
- The transaction provides liquidity to limited partners of East Ventures 5 L.P. (EV5) and achieves a DPI ratio of approximately 2.0x.
- EV5 focuses on seed and early-stage investments in Southeast Asian technology companies, including notable investments in IDN and Waresix.
- The structure includes a profit participation component, allowing limited partners to realize returns while retaining growth potential in the fund's portfolio.

items.title: SEA funding round sizes over the past 5 years
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- The article reviews funding round sizes for SEA over the past five years.
- It breaks down funding amounts by year and highlights trends.
- The insights cater to investors and firms interested in SEA's funding landscape.

items.title: Indian agritech startup raises $4.5m series A
items.summary:
- An Indian agritech startup has successfully raised $4.5 million in Series A funding.
- The funding will be utilized to expand its operations and enhance its product offerings in the agritech sector.
- This investment highlights the increasing interest in agritech innovations in India.

items.title: Indian restaurant chain raises $3m for expansion
items.author: Ankit Gupta, Chirag Chhajer
items.summary:
- Mumbai-based restaurant chain Burma Burma has raised ₹25.46 crore (around US$3 million) in funding led by Negen Capital.
- Additional investors included NV Alpha Fund Management and several high-net-worth individuals (HNIs).
- Founded in 2014, Burma Burma specializes in Burmese cuisine and operates 12 restaurants across major Indian cities.
- The company plans to expand its operations to a total of 24 outlets by the end of the financial year 2026, using the new funds over the next 15 months.

items.title: BYD to complete $1b Indonesia plant by year-end
items.summary:
- BYD's $1 billion factory in Subang, West Java, is expected to be completed by the end of 2025.
- The plant will have an annual production capacity of 150,000 electric vehicles (EVs).
- Construction is reported to be progressing smoothly and on schedule, with production anticipated to start shortly after completion.

items.title: China defends TikTok’s independence after Trump’s proposal
items.summary:
- China’s foreign ministry emphasized that companies should operate independently.
- This statement was made in response to Trump’s proposal for a 50% US ownership stake in TikTok.
- The comments underline tensions between the US and China over tech ownership and control.

items.title: X launches new video tab feature for US users
items.summary:
- X, formerly known as Twitter, launched a dedicated video tab for US users.
- The feature adds a vertical video feed to the app’s bottom bar for easier access.
- It describes the tab as “an immersive new home for videos.”
- Users can tap on videos and scroll for more content in a centralized area.
- This update comes as TikTok and Lemon8 are removed from US app stores.

items.title: Bluesky launches custom feed for TikTok-like vertical videos
Trump’s crypto token hits $9.2b ahead of inauguration
Nazara Technologies secures $57.17m for global gaming growth
Indian trading app Groww chooses banks for $8b IPO
ID fashion firms face sourcing dilemma
These are the most active investors in China’s startups
items.summary:
- The article lists investors who are most active in China-based startups based on investments made over the past two years.
- It focuses on firms that have invested in three or more companies within this timeframe.
- The data is continuously updated and aims to reflect the impact of each firm in the startup ecosystem.
- For inaccuracies or missing information, the article provides a contact email for updates.

items.title: India’s Paytm expands in Singapore, UAE, Saudi Arabia
items.summary:
- One 97 Communications, parent company of Paytm, plans to expand to Singapore, UAE, and Saudi Arabia.
- Investment of up to 20 crore rupees ($2.31 million) in each market for merchant payment and financial services.
- Strategy includes organic growth, partnerships, and local licensing.
- Bimal Julka appointed as a non-executive independent director, previously from the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting.

items.title: Syfe expands team after achieving profit in 2024
items.summary:
- Syfe, a Singapore-based wealth management platform, achieved profitability in 2024 and is expanding its team.
- The company is hiring for senior roles in Singapore, including a vice president of marketing and head of public relations.
- In FY 2024, Syfe’s revenue increased by 66%, and it successfully raised $27 million for growth in key markets like India.

items.title: India’s Paytm narrows Q3 losses to $24m
items.summary:
- One 97 Communications reports Q3 net loss of 208.3 crore rupees (around US$24 million), improved from 219.8 crore (around US$25.4 million) loss year-on-year.
- Consolidated revenue from operations decreased by 36% year-on-year to 1,827.8 crore rupees (around US$212 million) but increased by 10% sequentially.
- Gross Merchandise Value (GMV) reached 5 lakh crore rupees (around US$58 billion), a 13% increase quarter-on-quarter.
- Payment services revenue in December quarter rose 8% to 1,059 crore rupees (around US$122.8 million); financial services revenue increased 34% to 502 crore rupees (around US$58.3 million).
- Net payment margin grew 5% quarter-on-quarter to 489 crore rupees (around US$56.7 million).
- Average Monthly Transacting Users (MTUs) in Q3FY25 were 7.0 crore (around US$812,000), just below Q2FY25's 7.1 crore (around US$826,000).

items.title: Paytm parent company narrows Q3 losses to $24m
items.summary:
- Paytm's parent company reported a reduced loss of $24 million in Q3.
- This marks a significant improvement compared to previous financial results.
- The company experienced growth in revenue and user engagement during the quarter.
- Analysts predict continued recovery if trends hold steady in the upcoming quarters.

items.title: LLM but make it skinny
items.author: Simon
items.summary:
- The rise of small language models promises lower costs and specific use case benefits, especially in areas with limited internet access.
- Approximately 8% of jobs in the Philippine business process outsourcing (BPO) sector have been eliminated due to genAI.
- Companies like Telstra and Singtel are investing heavily in AI, with Telstra launching a joint venture with Accenture to enhance its genAI adoption.

items.title: Series SEA: Who’s investing in the region’s fintech startups?
items.summary:
- Overview of active investors in Southeast Asia’s fintech sector over the past two years.
- Data includes a list of firms ranked by the number of deals they’ve completed.
- Focus on firms that have invested in three or more startups in the region within the specified timeframe.

items.title: Melania Trump launches new crypto coin
items.summary:
- A new cryptocurrency called “The Official Melania Meme” was launched on January 20, 2025.
- The token is known as $Melania and is available for purchase.
- More details can be found on the [official website](http://melaniameme.com).
- President-elect Donald Trump has also launched a cryptocurrency called $Trump, reaching a market valuation of US$32 billion shortly after its launch on January 19, 2025.
- The $Trump coin surged 600% shortly after its debut event ‘Crypto Ball’.

items.title: Indian B2B procurement startup raises $1.72m seed funding
items.author: Anshu Kandhari, Pankaj Bisht, Somdutt Parashar, Tushar Agarwal
items.summary:
- ProcureYard, a B2B procurement startup in Gurugram, raised $1.72 million in seed funding.  
- Funding led by Powerhouse Ventures with additional investments from Java Capital, 2am VC, and angel investors.  
- Founded in 2023, ProcureYard focuses on raw material procurement in construction, manufacturing, and infrastructure.  
- Funds will be used for product development, working capital, and enhancing its conversational AI platform.

items.title: Trader profits $90m in Trump memecoin surge
items.summary:
- A trader reportedly earned over US$90 million after Trump announced the Trump memecoin.
- The trader exchanged 1.09 million USDC for 5.7 million Trump tokens on the Meteora market shortly after launch.
- Paid an US$85,000 fee for expedited transactions and later sold some tokens for US$3.65 million.
- The trader currently retains 4.62 million Trump tokens valued at US$87 million.

items.title: Memecoin app Moonshot tops US finance apps amid $Trump surge
items.summary:
- Moonshot, a memecoin launchpad on the Solana blockchain, is the top finance app on the US Apple App Store.
- The $Trump token, linked to President-elect Donald Trump, surged in value, exceeding a fully diluted valuation of US$30 billion.
- Moonshot is the primary purchasing platform for the $Trump token, leading to increased traffic and a transaction volume nearing US$400 million since launch.

items.title: Israel launches sandbox program for tech innovation
items.summary:
- Israel's Ministry of Justice has introduced a "Regulatory Sandbox" program for tech innovation.
- The program allows companies to test technologies with adjusted regulatory conditions to overcome bureaucratic challenges.
- It aims to facilitate cost-efficient and locally overseen technological advancements.
- Key focus industries include alternative food production, autonomous vehicles, and AI-driven traffic systems.

items.title: TSMC confident in CHIPS Act funding under Trump
items.summary:
- TSMC is optimistic about US government funding under President-elect Donald Trump.
- The company will receive $6.6 billion in subsidies under the CHIPS Act for building three semiconductor plants in Arizona.
- TSMC has already received $1.5 billion in Q4 2024, with further funding contingent on meeting milestones.

items.title: Trump considers 50% US ownership in TikTok JV
items.summary:
- President-elect Donald Trump plans to extend the timeline for enforcing a TikTok ban to allow for national security negotiations.
- A proposed solution includes forming a joint venture with a 50% US ownership stake, though specifics on whether it would be by the government or a private company are not detailed.
- An executive order is expected on Jan. 20 that will protect companies assisting TikTok during negotiations from legal liability.

items.title: Meta’s policy changes spark employee concerns in UK
items.summary:
- Meta announced the elimination of fact-checking initiatives and diversity programs, raising employee concerns in the UK.
- The Prospect union warned that these changes could harm the company's reputation and talent retention.
- Concerns were expressed about reduced workplace inclusivity and potential discrimination against marginalized communities, including the LGBTQ+.
- Meta plans to cut 5% of its global workforce, affecting approximately 3,600 employees, including those in the UK.
- The union is seeking assurances against arbitrary performance reviews linked to a new evaluation system.

items.title: Biden cybersecurity adviser resigns amid AI, China threats
items.summary:
- Anne Neuberger, the deputy national security adviser for cyber and emerging technology, resigned on January 17.
- Neuberger focused on AI, China, and software liability during her tenure.
- Key programs overseen included two executive orders on cybersecurity and the US Cyber Trust Mark program.
- China-backed cyberattacks on US infrastructure were a significant concern during her administration.
- Her departure highlights the ongoing threats to critical infrastructure security, particularly from China.

items.title: Rakuten justifies mobile losses with AI investment: CEO
items.author: Hiroshi Mikitani
items.summary:
- Hiroshi Mikitani, CEO of Rakuten, highlights the company's mobile division's role in AI growth.
- Rakuten, in Japan’s wireless market for four years, reports ongoing financial losses.
- The mobile segment has over 8 million users and leverages user data for AI applications.
- Rakuten plans to develop an AI assistant for shopping and travel markets.
- Former Google expert Ting Cai has been hired to advance Rakuten's AI technologies.

items.title: ‘Been there, done that’ isn’t enough: a VC’s founder playbook
items.summary:
- Recent data indicates that repeat entrepreneurs secure more funding than first-time founders.
- Venture capitalists often prefer experienced founders, but this does not guarantee success.
- Assessing first-time founders involves evaluating their character, integrity, and ability to manage substantial funds.
- First-time founders are often overwhelmed and need to demonstrate multitasking skills, known as "helicopter" skills.
- Reference checks can reveal important insights about a founder's character and past experiences.

items.title: Japan’s startup funding, as explained in charts
items.summary:
- Article offers insights into Japan's startup funding landscape through charts and data.
- Divided into weekly updates featuring notable investors and companies.
- Includes macro trends analysis of funding across different verticals and stages.

items.title: UK confirms no plans to ban TikTok
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- The UK government has confirmed that there are no current plans to impose a ban on TikTok.
- This decision reflects a recent trend among several countries reconsidering bans on the popular social media platform.
- UK officials emphasize that discussions regarding cybersecurity are ongoing, but no formal actions against TikTok have been taken.

items.title: Oyo set to file IPO by Q1 FY25: sources
items.summary:
- Oyo plans to file its draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) for an IPO by Q1 FY25.
- This is Oyo's third attempt to go public after two previous withdrawals.
- The IPO follows restructuring and debt financing, with early investors like Lightspeed Venture Partners looking to sell stakes.
- Oyo reported its first ever profit of 229 crore rupees (US$26.49 million) for FY24 and 132 crore rupees (US$15.27 million) for Q1 FY25.
- Recent developments include notable funding rounds and acquisitions, enhancing its market position.

items.title: Airwallex names new marketing VP for APAC
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Airwallex appoints Andrew Balint as VP of marketing for APAC, excluding China.
- Balint will lead marketing in Australia, New Zealand, Singapore, Hong Kong, and Malaysia, effective immediately.
- He has 25 years of marketing experience, previously serving as VP of marketing for ANZ and Asia-Pacific at Afterpay.
- Balint's responsibilities include branding, integrated campaigns, growth marketing, and partnerships.
- Airwallex reports an 83% year-on-year revenue increase in APAC for 2024.

items.title: Edtech firm BrightChamps acquires India’s Edjust
items.author: Dushyant Panchal, Anmol Mittal, Sanjay Panikar
items.summary:
- BrightChamps acquires Edjust, an Indian K12 education marketplace, in a cash and stock deal.
- This is BrightChamps’s fourth acquisition since 2020, following Education10x, Schola, and Metamorphosis Edu.
- Edjust, founded in 2022, has a presence in the US and UK, focusing on edtech services with AI and data systems.
- Post-acquisition, Edjust’s founders will expand the sales model across BrightChamps' operating regions.
- Edjust's team will develop a new distribution channel for core academic subjects like mathematics, science, and English.

items.title: TikTok restored in US amid legal risks for providers
items.summary:
- TikTok regained access in the US on January 20, 2025, following the expiration of the congressional mandate for divestment from ByteDance.
- Service providers like Oracle, Apple, and Google may face legal risks continuing to operate TikTok, with potential fines reaching up to US$5,000 per user.
- Over 170 million users and 7 million small businesses could be impacted by these legal actions.

items.title: Meta to launch video editing app for creators on iOS
items.summary:
- Meta is launching a new video editing app named "Edits" next month, announced by Instagram head Adam Mosseri on Threads.
- The app will first be available on iOS, with an Android version planned for later.
- Edits will feature a high-quality camera, tools for organizing ideas, an inspiration tab, and a draft sharing option for collaborations.
- Users will access performance insights for their published videos on Instagram.

items.title: Mobility platform Rapido expands to 500 cities in India
items.summary:
- Rapido plans to expand its mobility services to 500 cities in India starting from February 2025.
- The expansion will initially target Karnataka, Gujarat, Tamil Nadu, West Bengal, and Rajasthan.
- Services will further extend to Punjab, Haryana, Uttar Pradesh, and Uttarakhand, with specific timelines yet to be confirmed.
- Founded in 2015, Rapido competes with Uber, Ola, and other emerging companies like Namma Yatri.
- The platform has completed over 200 crore rides, averaging 3.6 million daily rides.
